original_solution_mapping.L1: For 6 months of the year he cuts his yard 15 days per month so he cuts his yard 6*15 = <<6*15=90>>90 times
original_solution_mapping.L2: For the remaining 6 months of the year, he cuts his yard three times a month so he cuts his yard 6*3 = <<6*3=18>>18 times
original_solution_mapping.L3: He cuts his yard 90 times for part of the year and 18 times for the rest of the year for a total of 90+18 = <<90+18=108>>108 times
original_solution_mapping.L4: There are 12 months in a year and he cuts his yard 108 times so he averages 108/12 = <<108/12=9>>9 times per month

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3029.
    Returns: the average number of times Mr. Roper cuts his yard per month.
    """
    # L1
    months_high_frequency = 6 # beginning in April and ending in September
    cuts_per_month_high_frequency = 15 # 15 days a month
    total_cuts_high_frequency = months_high_frequency * cuts_per_month_high_frequency

    # L2
    months_low_frequency = 6 # From October to the end of March
    cuts_per_month_low_frequency = 3 # three times a month
    total_cuts_low_frequency = months_low_frequency * cuts_per_month_low_frequency

    # L3
    total_annual_cuts = total_cuts_high_frequency + total_cuts_low_frequency

    # L4
    months_in_year = 12 # WK
    average_cuts_per_month = total_annual_cuts / months_in_year

    # FA
    answer = average_cuts_per_month
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: For {months_high_frequency} months of the year he cuts his yard {cuts_per_month_high_frequency} days per month so he cuts his yard {months_high_frequency}*{cuts_per_month_high_frequency} = <<{months_high_frequency}*{cuts_per_month_high_frequency}={total_cuts_high_frequency}>>{total_cuts_high_frequency} times

For the remaining {months_low_frequency} months of the year, he cuts his yard {cuts_per_month_low_frequency} times a month so he cuts his yard {months_low_frequency}*{cuts_per_month_low_frequency} = <<{months_low_frequency}*{cuts_per_month_low_frequency}={total_cuts_low_frequency}>>{total_cuts_low_frequency} times

He cuts his yard {total_cuts_high_frequency} times for part of the year and {total_cuts_low_frequency} times for the rest of the year for a total of {total_cuts_high_frequency}+{total_cuts_low_frequency} = <<{total_cuts_high_frequency}+{total_cuts_low_frequency}={total_annual_cuts}>>{total_annual_cuts} times

There are {months_in_year} months in a year and he cuts his yard {total_annual_cuts} times so he averages {total_annual_cuts}/{months_in_year} = <<{total_annual_cuts}/{months_in_year}={average_cuts_per_month}>>{average_cuts_per_month} times per month

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: For the remaining 6 months of the year, he cuts his yard 3 times a month so he cuts his yard 6*3 = <<6*3=18>>18 times

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: There are 12 months in a year and he cuts his yard 108 times so he averages 108/12 = <<108/12=1296>>1296 times per month

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
